channel.title: 48-Hours on 48 Hours – City Guides for Fast Trips
channel.description: Recent content in 48-Hours on 48 Hours – City Guides for Fast Trips

item.title: 48 Hours in Washington, DC
item.description: Smithsonian museums, pandas at the National Zoo, hands-on exhibits for kids, and the monuments that define America’s capital.

item.title: 48 Hours in Glen Rose, TX
item.description: Dinosaur tracks, wildlife safaris, riverside parks, and small-town museums in the ‘Dinosaur Capital of Texas.’

item.title: 4 Days in Palm Springs with Kids
item.description: Palm Springs mixes desert landscape with family-friendly attractions. In four days you can ride an aerial tramway into the mountains, visit museums and zoos, explore aviation history, and take a day trip to Joshua Tree National Park.

item.title: 48 Hours in Austin, TX
item.description: A weekend guide to Austin’s food, music, and springs

item.title: 48 Hours in Bacharach
item.description: Bacharach sits on a sharp bend of the Rhine, framed by vineyards and medieval towers. The town feels frozen in time, with half-timbered houses, a ruined castle, and cobbled streets that look unchanged for centuries. Two days here give you river views, wine, and a slower rhythm.

item.title: 48 Hours in Bentonville, AR
item.description: Weekend in Bentonville with Crystal Bridges art and trails, the Museum of Native American History, and a quirky detour to Rogers’ Daisy Airgun Museum.

item.title: 48 Hours in Chicago, IL
item.description: Two days of Chicago highlights: Art Institute, Millennium Park, river architecture tour, Museum of Science and Industry, Shedd, and food from The Purple Pig to the Aviary.

item.title: 48 Hours in Denver, CO
item.description: Stay at the Brown Palace, see the Denver Art Museum and Kirkland Museum, snack at Leven Deli, and dine farm‑to‑table—history, art, and food in two days.

item.title: 48 Hours in Eureka Springs, AR
item.description: Haunted Crescent Hotel, vintage railway rides, winding shop streets, and folk‑art oddity Quigley’s Castle in a hillside Ozark town.

item.title: 48 Hours in Frankfurt
item.description: Frankfurt mixes old Germany with a skyline of glass towers. The city moves on finance, trade fairs, and Apfelwein. Two days give enough time to see medieval squares, museums on the river, and the markets that locals love.

item.title: 48 Hours in Houston
item.description: Museum District, butterflies and Fabergé at HMNS, MFAH light tunnels, Bayou Bend, NASA’s Johnson Space Center, and barbecue runs across the city.

item.title: 48 Hours in Luxembourg City
item.description: Luxembourg City sits high above rivers and valleys, a fortress that became a crossroads. Old walls meet EU towers. Two days here mix history, food, and quiet walks in a compact capital.

item.title: 48 Hours in Memphis
item.description: Memphis offers history, culture, and tunes. You can live among legends here. We start with Graceland. Then we explore science, river lore, and quiet parks.

item.title: 48 Hours in Oklahoma City, OK
item.description: Stay in the Art Deco splendor of The National Hotel and walk to Paycom Center for NBA games or concerts—OKC’s history and present on one downtown weekend.

item.title: 48 Hours in Paris
item.description: Paris sets the standard for beauty, food, and style. A short stay gives a taste of cafés, museums, and the city’s streets that feel like an open-air gallery. Two days let you walk along the Seine, climb the Eiffel Tower, and sit at a café terrace watching the city pass.

item.title: 48 Hours in Tulsa, OK
item.description: A weekend guide to Tulsa’s hotels, food, coffee, and family fun
